site.name: Duomo di San Gennaro
site.description: Home to the city's patron saint, San Gennaro, this magnificent cathedral showcases stunning Gothic and Baroque architecture. Don’t miss the Chapel of the Treasure of San Gennaro and its relics.

site.name: Piazza del Plebiscito
site.description: A grand square in Naples, known for its historical significance and beautiful architecture.

site.name: Castel dell'Ovo
site.description: The oldest standing fortification in Naples, located on the sea, offering stunning views.

site.name: Vesuvius Volcano
site.description: One of the world’s most famous active volcanoes, offering breathtaking views of Naples and the Bay of Naples. Visitors can hike to the crater for a unique experience.

site.name: National Archaeological Museum
site.description: Home to one of the most impressive collections of Greco-Roman antiquities, including artifacts from Pompeii and Herculaneum.

site.name: Palazzo Reale di Napoli
site.description: A grand royal palace that was once home to Spanish and later Neapolitan monarchs. It offers opulent rooms and expansive gardens with views of the Gulf of Naples.

site.name: Spaccanapoli
site.description: A narrow, bustling street that cuts through the heart of Naples, known for its vibrant shops, churches, and traditional Neapolitan pizzerias.

site.name: Quartieri Spagnoli
site.description: Known for its narrow alleys, vibrant street art, and local life, the Spanish Quarter offers an authentic glimpse of traditional Neapolitan culture.
